critique: The document expresses the delegation of power to the Administrator for Industrial Recovery. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy that the policy of said title with respect to transactions in or affecting interstate or foreign commerce will be consistent with the requirements of clause (2) of subsection (a) of section 3 of said act. The tone is formal and authoritative, suggesting a desire for respect and compliance rather than strong emotional reactions. The language is legalistic and focused on the practical implementation of the National Industrial Recovery Act. There is not enough information to determine the emotions of sadness, anger, fear, disgust, and surprise.
